page.title: 12HOUSING IN HARDWICK
page.content: The houses in the area reflected the care and hard work of the residents. They were{modernised, well-maintained and a pleasure to look at. Many of the houses are farm houses-{stone built, {large, detached}and fairly{old. However, alongside these are relatively new{bungalows}and{houses- modern yet blending in with the surrounding buildings. There are also some{terraced cottages}close to Hardwick Hall. Many of the houses in the area belong to the{National Trust,}which owns a large proportion of the land. The houses owned by them are rented out to the occupants. There is also a{council housing estate in Glapwell- houses owned and maintained by the local authority.
